org.firstinspires.ftc.team9202hme.navigation

Class Navigator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.team9202hme.navigation.Navigator

  • public class Navigator
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of functions for locating images in 3D space, using the robot controller phone's camera
    Author:
    Nathaniel Glover

    • Constructor Detail

      • Navigator

        public Navigator(CameraSide cameraSide,
                 PhoneOrientation orientation,
                 int maxSimultaneousImageTargets,
                 boolean showCameraFeedbackOnPhone)
        Creates the Navigator with necessary parameters
        Parameters:
        cameraSide - The camera that will be used to locate images
        orientation - The orientation of the phone on the robot
        maxSimultaneousImageTargets - The maximum number of image targets that can be tracked at one time
        showCameraFeedbackOnPhone - Whether or not what the camera is seeing should be displayed on the robot controller phone. This is good for debugging, but eats through the phone battery

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializes the Navigator. This should be called during either TeleOpProgram.init() or AutonomousProgram.run() and is necessary for the Navigator class to function properly

      • canSeeTarget

        public boolean canSeeTarget(ImageTarget target)
        Checks if an image is visible
        Parameters:
        target - The image to look for
        Returns:
        Whether or not it is visible

      • getRelativeTargetTranslation

        public Vector3 getRelativeTargetTranslation(ImageTarget target)
        Returns the position, using right-hand rule, of the image in 3D space
        Parameters:
        target - The image to locate
        Returns:
        The translation of the image in 3D space, relative to the phone, where x is the distance from the origin on the x axis, y is the distance from the origin on the y axis, and z is the distance from the origin on the z axis. These values are all given in millimeters, and use the right-hand rule to determine the meaning of positive and negative values

      • getRelativeTargetRotation

        public Vector3 getRelativeTargetRotation(ImageTarget target)
        Returns the rotation, of the image in 3D space
        Parameters:
        target - The image to locate
        Returns:
        The rotation of the image in 3D space, relative to the phone, using Euler angles, where x is pitch, y is yaw, and z is roll, and all are in degrees, where a clockwise rotation is positive

      • getCameraSide

        public CameraSide getCameraSide()
        Getter for cameraSide
        Returns:
        The camera being used to locate images

      • getOrientation

        public PhoneOrientation getOrientation()
        Getter for orientation
        Returns:
        The orientation of the phone on the robot
